message_1: How many ways are there to split a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets?
message_2:
To split a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets, we can use the Bell number. The Bell number B(n) counts the number of ways to partition a set of n elements into non-empty subsets. 

For a set of 6 elements, the Bell number B(6) = 203.

So, there are 203 ways to split a set of 6 elements into non-empty subsets.
